definitions.definition: A person who is indifferent or apathetic.
Not caring or concerned; uninterested, apathetic.
definitions.example: He was indifferent to the proposal, since it didn’t affect him, either way.

definitions.definition: Indicating or reflecting a lack of concern or care.
definitions.example: She responded with an indifferent shrug.

definitions.definition: Mediocre (usually used negatively in modern usage).
definitions.example: The long distance and the indifferent roads made the journey impossible.

definitions.definition: Having no preference or bias, being impartial.
definitions.example: I am indifferent between the two plans.

definitions.definition: Not making a difference; without significance or importance.
definitions.example: Even if one appliance consumes an indifferent amount of energy when left on stand-by overnight, together they can represent 10% of the electricity demand of a household.

definitions.definition: Being in the state of neutral equilibrium.
To some extent, in some degree (intermediate between very and not at all); moderately, tolerably, fairly.
definitions.example: The face of the Moon appearing to me to be full of indifferent high mountains...
